attributes.action: Remove LTN’s and single lanes on main roads
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to do this for the greater good of Londoners who drive and commute around London on a daily basis that are suffering with heavy traffic a major roads and roads/lanes being reduced to one single lane inconveniencing the 100’s of thousands of drivers across the city. These implications benefit absolutely no one and only causes problems and inconveniences for the majority.
attributes.background: Get rid of LTN’s and traffic build up caused by it.

rejection.details:
Decisions on whether to implement low traffic neighbourhoods is for local authorities and not for the UK Government or Parliament.

We currently have the following petitions open on this issue, which you might like to sign:

Carry out an independent review into Low Traffic Neighbourhoods (LTNs)
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/632748

Require councils remove LTNs and underused bike lanes that lack public support
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/633504

Remove local authority powers to introduce LTNs, CAZs, LEZs and ULEZs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637517
